IPLS workshop 30 April 2021
Setup instructions

Using Desktop@UCL

At Desktop@UCL you can find Anaconda and a terminal (git bash). If you want to access anaconda from within git bash you’ll need to follow these steps:

  1. Open git bash 2.22.0
  2. Type echo $HOME. If it doesn’t show /n/, then:
    1. Create a new file with nano: nano ~/.bash_profile
    2. Add the following content to it: 
       OLDHOME="${HOME}"  
 export HOME="/n/"  
 cd $HOME [[ ! -f OLDHOME/.bash_profile ]] && cp $HOME/.bash_profile $OLDHOME
  3. Open a new git bash terminal and run: conda init bash (this may say that the operation failed, but it’s OK)
  4. Open a new terminal again. It may show a bash error at the start, but everything should work fine.
  • UCL Research Software Development Group
